text: do you struggle with getting out of bed
in the morning do you always wake up
tired no matter how much sleep you get
if so you're not alone according to a
survey the average American takes 24
minutes to get out of bed after waking
up 29 report feeling groggy and only 11
report feeling motivated to start the
day in this video we'll go over four
tips you can use to wake up with more
energy ready to take on the day so let's
jump right into it tip number one no
alarm clock a study was conducted in
2016 where they took 16 men and had them
spend four days and nights in a lab they
separated the group in two one group was
awoken with alarm clocks while the other
group woke up naturally the researchers
then took saliva samples to measure
their cortisol levels they discovered
that the group who used alarm clocks to
wake up had significantly higher levels
of cortisol in their body at night as
compared to the group who woke up
naturally having higher levels of
cortisol at night is usually a bad thing
because it makes it harder for you to
fall asleep this increases your chances
of not getting enough sleep which will
only make you feel even more tired when
you do wake up so try your best to avoid
using an alarm clock to wake up in the
mornings tip number two is to avoid
alcohol a study was conducted in 2015
where researchers gathered 24
participants for all regular drinkers
the participants were divided into two
groups one was given alcohol before bed
and the other was given a non-alcoholic
Placebo the researchers then recorded
the participants brain waves while they
slept the study found that alcohol
increased their Alpha Waves which are
the brain waves linked with being awake
and alert which suggests that alcohol
might cause disruptions during sleep and
negatively impact daytime function so
try to avoid alcohol as much as possible
even if it's just one drink right before
bedtime tip number three have an evening
routine in a 2009 study 160 students
were asked to keep track of their sleep
for two weeks and were then asked to
fill out questionnaires about Sleep
Quality daytime sleepiness and fatigue
the researchers defined irregular
bedtime frequent Quincy as the number of
nights where a person's bedtime Changed
by more than an hour from their usual
bedtime in the past two weeks the study
found that students with an irregular
bedtime schedule had poor Sleep Quality
and shorter average sleep time per day
which could lead to sleep insufficiency
try to go to sleep at about the same
time every night you can do this by
developing some sort of nighttime
routine or ritual ideally it should be
something that is relaxing and does not
involve staring at a screen some
examples could be reading a book
listening to a podcast or other YouTube
videos journaling praying meditating and
so on speaking of routines this episode

premium Global brand for Men's Grooming
and hygiene products if you value
quality and convenience in your bathroom
products for your hygiene routine
manscaped is the place for you manscaped

now back to the topic at hand tip number
four get some sunlight a study was
conducted where participants were
separated into two groups one was
exposed just a natural light after
waking up while the other was exposed to
artificial light the participants were
exposed to Natural Light performed
better on cognitive and memory tests and
reported feeling less sleepy throughout
the day human beings have an internal
clock called the Circadian rhythm which
regulates our sleep cycles we have
special light receptors in our eyes that
react to sunlight when sunlight reaches
our eyes in the morning our body
releases certain hormones that help
regulate our clock this makes us feel
more energized in the morning when we
need it a more sleepy at night making it
easier to get a good night's rest if you
want to feel energized in the morning
get some sunlight into your eyes as soon
as you wake up if there is no natural
sunlight because of changing seasons you
can purchase certain lights online that
will have the same effect I hope these
tips have been helpful let me know in
the comments down below which tip you're
going to try to incorporate into your
routine and if there are any other tips
that you know of to start your day the
right way you can also check my other
